meanings.definition: To behave in a showy or ostentatious manner in order to impress others.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, the politician kept grandstanding to gain attention.
meanings.sent2: She was always grandstanding at parties, trying to show off her wealth.
meanings.sent3: The peacock's grandstanding in the zoo made all the visitors laugh.
meanings.sent4: The magician's grandstanding on stage captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The actor's grandstanding in the play left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The action or behavior of grandstanding.
meanings.sent1: His constant grandstanding during meetings annoyed his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The grandstanding at the award ceremony overshadowed the actual winners.
meanings.sent3: The cat's grandstanding in front of the mirror was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The grandstanding of the waves crashing against the shore was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The politician's grandstanding in the parliament became a topic of discussion nationwide.
